_meta.canvasDescription: A document processing tool that extracts structured content from business documents and converts them into machine-readable formats. Upload PDF, Word, Excel, or PowerPoint files and get back clean, structured data in JSON or Markdown format. The agent extracts text, tables, metadata, and can describe images using AI vision.
_meta.description: Pronghorn.RED Canvas Export - contains architecture diagram nodes, edges, and layers. This file can be imported back to recreate the canvas.

_documentation.overview: This JSON file represents a visual architecture canvas. An AI or human can interpret this structure to understand or recreate the diagram.

nodeStructure.description: Each node represents an architectural element on the canvas

fields.id: Unique UUID identifier for the node
fields.type: React Flow node type: 'custom' (standard architecture nodes), 'notes' (sticky notes with markdown), 'zone' (grouping containers), 'label' (text labels)
fields.position: X,Y coordinates on the canvas (origin is top-left)
fields.data.type: Semantic node type from nodeTypes list (e.g., 'PAGE', 'COMPONENT', 'DATABASE', 'API_SERVICE')
fields.data.label: Primary display text / node title
fields.data.subtitle: Optional secondary descriptive text
fields.data.content: For notes nodes, contains markdown content
fields.style: Optional CSS-like styling object (width, height, backgroundColor)

fields.id: Unique UUID identifier for the edge
fields.source: ID of the source node (where arrow starts)
fields.target: ID of the target node (where arrow ends)
fields.label: Optional connection label (e.g., 'uses', 'calls', 'depends on')

layerStructure.description: Layers organize nodes into toggleable visibility groups

fields.id: Unique UUID identifier for the layer
fields.name: Display name for the layer
fields.node_ids: Array of node IDs belonging to this layer
fields.visible: Whether the layer is currently visible (true/false)

_documentation.connectionRules: The connectionRules section defines valid source->target relationships and the left-to-right flow hierarchy for node types

nodeTypes.description: Resizable background zone for grouping nodes
Reusable code block or utility function

connectionRules.description: Valid connections follow a left-to-right flow hierarchy. Lower levels appear on the left, higher levels on the right.

data.label: chat CLI Command
data.subtitle: file-parser-cli interactive
data.description: Provides an interactive chat interface, potentially using the API wrapper's conversational capabilities.
